|  [assertIncludes(haystack, needle, message)](./pentf.assertincludes.md) | Assert that a string is included in another, or object is included in an array. |

|  [assertNotIncludes(haystack, needle, message)](./pentf.assertnotincludes.md) | Assert that a string is <b>not</b> included in another, or object is <b>not</b> included in an array. |
|  [assertNotSelector(page, selector, { timeout, message })](./pentf.assertnotselector.md) | Asserts that a selector is not present in the passed page or frame. |
|  [assertNotTestId(page, testId, { timeout, message })](./pentf.assertnottestid.md) | Asserts that an element identified by a test ID (<code>data-testid=</code> attribute) is not present in the passed page or frame. |
|  [assertNotXPath(page, xpath, options, \_timeout, \_checkEvery)](./pentf.assertnotxpath.md) | Assert that there is currently no element matching the XPath on the page. |
|  [assertNumeric(x, message)](./pentf.assertnumeric.md) | Assert that a value is a Number or BigInt. |
|  [assertValue(input, expected)](./pentf.assertvalue.md) | Assert an <code>&lt;input&gt;</code> element having a certain value (after a wait if necessary). |
|  [catchLater(promise)](./pentf.catchlater.md) | Avoid <code>UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning</code> if a promise fails before we <code>await</code> it. |
|  [clickNestedText(page, textOrRegExp, { timeout, checkEvery, extraMessage, visible, assertSuccess, retryUntil })](./pentf.clicknestedtext.md) | Click any element by its text content.<!-- -->The text can span multiple nodes compared to <code>clickText</code> which matches direct descended text nodes only. |
|  [clickSelector(page, selector, { timeout, checkEvery, message, visible, assertSuccess, retryUntil })](./pentf.clickselector.md) | Clicks an element address ed by a query selector atomically, e.g. within the same event loop run as finding it. |
|  [clickTestId(page, testId, { extraMessage, timeout, visible, assertSuccess, retryUntil })](./pentf.clicktestid.md) | Click an element identified by a test ID (<code>data-testid=</code> attribute). Selecting and clicking happens in the same tick, so this is safe to call even if the client application may currently be rerendering. |
|  [clickText(page, text, { timeout, checkEvery, elementXPath, extraMessage, assertSuccess, retryUntil })](./pentf.clicktext.md) | Click a link, button, label, or input by its text content. |
|  [clickXPath(page, xpath, options)](./pentf.clickxpath.md) | Clicks an element addressed by XPath atomically, e.g. within the same event loop run as finding it.
```javascript
await clickXPath(
    page, '//article[.//h1//text()[contains(., "My form")]]/button',
    {message: 'Could not find the button in the foobar form'}
);

```

|  [expectedToFail(config, message, asyncFunc, { expectNothing })](./pentf.expectedtofail.md) | Mark a code section as expected to fail. If the async function throws an error, the error will be included in reports, but not counted as a test failure. If the async function succeeds, a warning will be printed. |
|  [fetch\_2(config, url, init)](./pentf.fetch_2.md) | fetch a URL. Apart from the first parameter, this implements the \[Fetch API\](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Fetch\_API). (Using this method rather than another enables outputting of curl commands with <code>-c</code> and a couple of defaults suitable for pentf). |

|  [newPage(config, chrome\_args)](./pentf.newpage.md) | Launch a new browser with puppeteer, with a new page (=Tab). The browser is completely isolated from any other calls. Most interactions will be with the page, but you can get the browser using <code>await page.browser();</code>. For more information about the page object, see the \[puppeteer API documentation\](https://github.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/blob/master/docs/api.md). |

|  [stringify(value, level)](./pentf.stringify.md) | Convert a value into a formatted string that can be used for comparisons. Contrary to <code>JSON.stringify(value, null, 2)</code> this will sort object properties which is necessary to get a meaningful diff. |
|  [takeScreenshot(config, page, fileName, selector)](./pentf.takescreenshot.md) |  |
|  [timeoutPromise(config, promise, { timeout, message, warning })](./pentf.timeoutpromise.md) | Raise an error if a promise does not finish within a certain timeframe. Note this does not cancel the promise itself (because that's impossible). |
|  [typeSelector(page, selector, text, { message, timeout })](./pentf.typeselector.md) | Type text into an element identified by a query selector. |
|  [valueRepr(value)](./pentf.valuerepr.md) | Generate a string representation for a random value. |
|  [waitForTestId(page, testId, { extraMessage, timeout, visible })](./pentf.waitfortestid.md) | Search for an element with the given <code>data-testid</code> attribute. |
|  [waitForText(page, text, { timeout, extraMessage })](./pentf.waitfortext.md) | Wait for text to appear on the page. |
|  [waitForVisible(page, selector, { message, timeout })](./pentf.waitforvisible.md) | Wait for an element matched by a CSS query selector to become visible. Visible means the element has neither <code>display:none</code> nor <code>visibility:hidden</code>. Elements outside the current viewport (e.g. you'd need to scroll) and hidden with CSS trickery (opacity, overlaid with z-index, or permanently positioned outside the viewport) count as visible. |
|  [workaround\_setContent(page, html)](./pentf.workaround_setcontent.md) |  |
